componentDescription: Evaluates whether applicant thinks about freedom, community, alternative ways of living

criteria.description: Asking about HOW TO LIVE (freedom, community, interdependence) vs. surface logistics (pay, hours)

scoreGuide.5-6: Genuine curiosity about philosophy. Some depth.
scoreGuide.7-8: Deep questions about living systems. Clear curiosity.
scoreGuide.9-10: Sophisticated inquiry. Connects personal to collective.

criteria.description: Can articulate what they're looking for and what matters to them

scoreGuide.3-4: Some articulation but mostly surface wants.
scoreGuide.5-6: Clear about what they're looking for.
scoreGuide.7-8: Deeply articulate. Names tensions and constraints.
scoreGuide.9-10: Connects personal needs to bigger living questions.

criteria.description: Links personal freedom to community. Sees connections and interdependence.

scoreGuide.3-4: Mentions community but doesn't go deep.
scoreGuide.5-6: Shows understanding personal + community are linked.
scoreGuide.9-10: Systems-level thinking about how living structures work.

criteria.description: Building/questioning/trying things vs. waiting to be told

scoreGuide.5-6: Clear evidence of building or questioning actively.

criteria.description: Genuine vs. performing. Can admit uncertainty without pretending.
Asks about Jim's thinking/philosophy vs. only logistics

scoreGuide.1-2: All one-directional. No questions about Jim.
scoreGuide.5-6: At least one genuine question about philosophy.
scoreGuide.7-8: Multiple questions showing curiosity about Jim's thinking.
